feed.title: SAP Community - SAP ERP
feed.subtitle: SAP ERP Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to Mass Delete Wrong PIR Validity Period After Incorrect Mass Upload
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

User accidentally uploaded incorrect PIR validity periods in bulk using our internal program mass upload of new validity period
Example mistake: validity start 20251101 to validity end 20251231 with price = 0.
Even after re-uploading the correct PIR, the wrong validity period still appears when I download the PIR again.

Question:
Is there a standard SAP method or mass maintenance transaction to delete / remove a specific validity period for multiple PIR condition records without manual editing one by one in ME12?

I have tried:

  • Re-uploading PIR with new validity period (did not remove old one) it just added a new entry

  • MEK2 / MEK3 → still shows old period

  • Manual delete in ME12 works but not feasible for volume

Requirement:
Delete all PIR validity periods that match:

  • Validity Start = 2025.11.01

  • Validity End = 2025.12.31

  • Price = 0
    …so that these wrong records do not appear when running the next PIR download.

Any suggestion?

  • Mass deletion via MEK2 (delete indicator)?

  • Using MASS for table KONH/KONP?

  • Is LSMW / BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS a better approach?

  • Or must we change the delete indicator field only?

Thank you!

entry.title: Backlog, Incoming Orders and Sales data
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm not an ABAP developer and have very limited knowledge with SAP. Using SAP ERP (not S4).
I'm trying to get a simple report showing backlog, incoming orders and sales per specific date or period.

From some reason this simple and accute business need seems to require custom transactions, complete overhauls and impossible technical understanding far beyond that of a business user.

Are there basic transactions I can use to generate this information?
Seems like a very basic need, but somehow google comes up short and this is an issue I had with every company I worked with using SAP.

Thanks

entry.title: Bulk Material rework production order
entry.content:
HI,  

I'm experiencing inconsistent behavior related to the Bulk Material (SCHGT) field in ZP04 (rework) type production order. We have a FERT component that:, 
The bulk material field is not flagged  in the master material (MRP2)
Is not marked as Bulk in the BOM
It cannot be manually marked in the production order, as the system does not allow changing this field due to cost relevance. However, in CO03 (Production Order → Component Overview), the field appears with “Cost Relevant” unchecked, “Backflush” unchecked, and “Bulk Material” checked.

The operations team states that:
They did not remove the "Cost Relevant" field They did not remove any flags in the reporting process
They did not manually mark the component as Bulk during the process

Only this reservation has SCHGT marked, with no evidence of manual alteration before or after the order was released.

Is there any standard behavior where SAP automatically marks SCHGT for rework?
Where can I review the change log for creating the OP (CO01)?

 

SAP ERP MAN Production Planning (PP)

entry.title: Asset sales in Colombia withholding tax
entry.content:
We are using sales order process for asset sales to calculate with holding taxes in Colombia company code where e-invoice process is used to submit details to Colombian tax authorities. But there is no option available to link the sales order to Asset master data to use it during asset retirement process.

 Please advise if there is any SAP notes/standard process to follow for asset sales in Colombia and tax reporting.

entry.title: What are the objects of Procure Drop Ship Item and Procure Non-Drop Ship Items?
entry.content:
I am developing a portal integrated with SAP B1 in ASP.NET MVC. I need to post checkboxes (Y/N) of Procure Drop Ship Items and Procure Non-Drop Ship Items in the logistic tab of Sales Order. Reference image is attached.
But I cannot find the object to send the value into. 
I have implemented the same for "Partial Delivery" checkbox of which the C# snippet is given below:
if (SaleOrder.PartialDelivery == "Y")
{
SO.PartialSupply = BoYesNoEnum.tYES;
}
else if (SaleOrder.PartialDelivery == "N")
{
SO.PartialSupply = BoYesNoEnum.tNO;
}

You see, I am posting the value (Y/N) into SO.PartialSupply. But I cannot find the object to post for the said checkboxes (The object for partial delivery is "PartialSupply")
if (SaleOrder.Procure == "Y")
{
SO.?????? = BoYesNoEnum.tYES;
}
else if (SaleOrder.Procure == "N")
{
SO.?????? = BoYesNoEnum.tNO;
}
if (SaleOrder.NoProcure == "Y")
{
SO.?????? = BoYesNoEnum.tYES;
}
else if (SaleOrder.NoProcure == "N")
{
SO.?????? = BoYesNoEnum.tNO;
}

The values are coming from column "PoDropPrss" and "PoPrss" respectively, of "ORDR".

entry.title: Can SAP Help European CEOs Win in Times of Global Turbulence?
entry.content:
Article Teaser:
You’re leading amid change. Markets shift, regulations tighten, supply chains wobble. How can SAP help you stay ahead, make bold decisions and build resilience?

The New Reality for Leaders

Today, change hits fast. A supplier drops. A new regulation lands. Demand shifts overnight. As a European CEO or CTO, waiting for monthly reports won’t work. You need insight in real time.

Why the ERP Market Matters

The European ERP software market is expected to grow to about USD 36.35 billion in 2025, up from roughly USD 30.82 billion in 2024. 

In the EU, around 73 % of SMEs already reach a basic level of digital intensity, but many still lack high-value tools. 

What SAP Brings to The Table

  • Connected systems: Finance, supply chain, HR and operations talk to each other.
  • Live data insight: You get up-to-date dashboards, not stale reports.
  • Embedded intelligence & automation: SAP brings smart tools that handle routine tasks so your team focuses on strategic work.

Why This Matters to You

When everything is linked, you move faster, decide better, bounce back quicker. Supply disruptions, cost spikes, talent gaps, they still happen. But you’re ready.

A Scenario that Could Be Yours

Imagine this: You see a raw-material price jump. Your system alerts you immediately. You check supplier capacity, stock on hand, and cost impact. You update forecasts and pricing in hours, not days. That’s connected enterprise in action.

Actions for Leaders

  • Align your data: Make sure all teams define and use metrics the same way.
  • Set governance and trust: Know who uses what data, why, and how decisions are made.
  • Enable agility: Give your teams tools and permission to act quickly with insight.

Conclusion

Uncertainty is here to stay. Speed and insight matter more than ever. SAP gives you the foundation. You bring the leadership. Together, you turn change intoan  advantage.

Soft CTA:
If you’re ready to explore how SAP solutions can strengthen your leadership in turbulent times, join discussions in the SAP Community or connect with experts who guide change across Europe. Feel free to reach me at neel.panchal@stridelysolutions.com to learn more.

Best regards,

Stefan

entry.title: SHORT DUMP：OBJECTS_OBJREF_NOT_ASSIGNED_NO
entry.content:
Hi All,

I know this runtime error has been discussed by many people. However, none of the solutions applied to my problem.

My system contains a custom report that uses an Excel template on OAOR to input data and then exports it as an Excel macro file.
An error occurs every time data is inserted into an Excel cell using the following statement, instead of an error occurring in each cell.

DEFINE cell_cls.  
  IF &3 IS NOT INITIAL.

*  translate &3 to upper case.
  FREE: gt_ranges, gt_input.
  CALL METHOD r_excel->insert_range_dim
    EXPORTING
      name     = 'cell'
      no_flush = 'X'
      top      = &1
      left     = &2
      rows     = 1
      columns  = 1
    IMPORTING
      error    = r_error.

  gs_ranges-name = 'cell'.
  gs_ranges-columns = &2.
  gs_ranges-rows = &1.
  APPEND gs_ranges TO gt_ranges .
  CLEAR gs_ranges .

  gs_input-column = 1.
  gs_input-row = 1.
  gs_input-value = &3.
  APPEND gs_input TO gt_input .
  CLEAR gs_input .

  CALL METHOD r_excel->set_ranges_data
    EXPORTING
      ranges   = gt_ranges
      contents = gt_input
      no_flush = 'X'
    IMPORTING
      error    = r_error.

  ENDIF.

END-OF-DEFINITION.

The problem doesn't occur every time it's run; it only happens to some users, and it's intermittent.

But I am absolutely certain that there was data when I filled in the storage cell.

In fact, this problem occurs in two reports, with one of them even reporting an error because ADRC-NAME1 is missing, which should be impossible.

Can someone provide any possible reasons for the problem?

English is not my usual language, so please ask any questions if anything is unclear.

Thank you all for your assistance!

entry.title: Asset depreciation need to reverse from sunset date (A021)
entry.content:
As per our business user Store - A021 was totally destroyed due to fire, resulting in the total loss of all associated assets. 

Depreciation need to calculate till 29th April 2025 for all assets in the system, over and above depreciation need to reversed in SAP.

Please find some example asset list for your reference :

105050015409
107000014373
107000014553

Currently users don't want to change any asset value, after received the insurance amount they cleared it manually.

So requesting you kindly help us how we can stop depreciation and guide us on the process to reverse the depreciation amount in case the particular asset has been posted with depreciation beyond 29th April ,2025.

entry.title: How to Connect Google Looker Studio with SAP HANA 2022 On-Premise?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m trying to connect Google Looker Studio with an SAP HANA 2022 on-premise system.

So far, I haven’t found a straightforward connector in Looker Studio that supports direct HANA connections.

If anyone has successfully set this up, could you please share the steps, configuration details, or any required middleware/connectors?

Key questions:

  • What is the recommended method to expose SAP HANA on-premise data to Looker Studio (e.g., JDBC/ODBC, APIs, Data Federation, Cloud Connector, etc.)?
  • Are there any specific network or authentication settings needed?
  • Is there an official or 3rd-party connector that works reliably?

Any guidance, documentation links, or step-by-step procedure would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Implementation and Customizing of Real-Time Instant Payments
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are currently analyzing the requirements for introducing real-time Instant Payments. Our system is SAP ERP 6.0 (ECC), and we would like to understand what needs to be done in order to technically support Instant Payments in the SAP payment process.

Could someone please clarify:

  1. Which steps or configuration activities are required to enable Instant Payments in ERP 6.0?

  2. Are there any SAP Notes, guides, or official implementation documents that describe the required setup?

Any guidance, experience, or references would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!
